clinical_study.brief_title: Cognitive Function and Health-related Quality of Life After Neuro-intensive Care
clinical_study.official_title: Cognitive Function and Health-related Quality of Life After Neuro-intensive Care: An Observational Multicenter Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: The study will provide information on cognitive impairment and Health related quality of life in patients surviving 12 months after acute brain injury, generate a hypothesis of useful variables to predict cognitive impairment or low levels of HRQoL, and potentially inform interventions for the prevention and treatment of cognitive impairment following neuro-ICU stay.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim is to 1) measure the frequency and extent of cognitive impairment after acute brain injury at six and 12-months after neuro-Intensive care unit (ICU) admission 2) explore the association between cognitive impairment at six and 12 months after ICU admission with the following potential risk factors: duration of ICU delirium (days), duration of sepsis (days), duration of post traumatic amnesia (days) and the severity of brain injury (initial Glasgow Coma Scale , 3) describe Health related quality of life, functional disability and frailty at six and 12 after ICU admission and 4) explore the association between the functional disability, frailty and health-related quality of life at 12 months after ICU admission

primary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline to 6 months after ICU admission
primary_outcome.description: measured by The Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neuropsychological Status, Overall score (mean 100; SD=15). Higher scores indicate better cognitive functioning.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline to 12 months after ICU admission
primary_outcome.description: measured by The Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neuropsychological Status, Overall score (mean 100; SD=15). Higher scores indicate better cognitive functioning.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline to 6 months after ICU admission
primary_outcome.description: measured by Trail Making Test B, Score indicate time in seconds to complete task, the higher speed (less seconds) indicates higher executive function

primary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline to 12 months after ICU admission
primary_outcome.description: measured by Trail Making Test B, Score indicate time in seconds to complete task, the higher speed (less seconds) indicates higher executive function

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Health related quality of life after brain injury
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline to 6 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: measured with a disease specific questionnaire:Quality of Life after Brain Injury overall scale (QOLIBRI-OS). Scores are from 0-100, the higher the score the more quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Health related quality of life after brain injury
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline to 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: measured with a disease specific questionnaire:Quality of Life after Brain Injury overall scale (QOLIBRI-OS). Scores are from 0-100, the higher the score the more quality of life.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the procedure (ICU stay) up to 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: measured by Confusion measured by CAM-ICU or Intensive Care Delirium Screening Checklist (ICDSC).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Disability after head injury/nontraumatic acute brain insults I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline to 6 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: measured by Glasgow outcome scale extended (GOSE). Scores from 1 to 8, higher scores indicate less disability

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Disability after head injury/nontraumatic acute brain insults I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline to 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: measured by Glasgow outcome scale extended (GOSE). Scores from 1 to 8, higher scores indicate less disability

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Disability after head injury/nontraumatic acute brain insults II
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline to 6 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: measured by Extended disability rating scale (DRS). Scores from 0 to 29, the higher the score the more disability

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Disability after head injury/nontraumatic acute brain insults II
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline to 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: measured by Extended disability rating scale (DRS). Scores from 0 to 29, the higher the score the more disability

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to 6 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: measured by the Clinical Frailty Scale (CFS). Scale is from 1 to 9 ( the higher score the more frail).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to 12 months after ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: measured by the Clinical Frailty Scale (CFS). Scale is from 1 to 9 ( the higher score the more frail).

study_pop.textblock: Adults with acute brain injury from traumatic brain injury, spontaneous intracranial hemorrhage, or ischemic stroke with a Neuro ICU stay

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Traumatic brain injury
- Spontaneous intracranial hemorrhage
- Ischemic stroke
- An anticipated stay in the neuro-ICU for 48 hours or longer.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Persistent coma defined as Richmond Agitation-Sedation Scale (RASS) -5 to -3 throughout the neuro-ICU stay
- Congenital brain injury
- Suspected pre-existing Cognitive impairment (Informant Questionnaire on cognitive decline in the elderly (IQCODE): 3.3 or more) (regardless of cause)
- Permanent residence outside Denmark
- Inability to communicate in Danish
